q:
Which of the following vulnerabilities can be detected in the following application security code of an AUT:

try {
File Demo = new File("object.obj");
ObjectInputStream in = new ObjectInputStream(new FileInputStream(Demo));
javax.swing.JButton button1 = (javax.swing.JButton) in.readObject();
in.close();
}

In application security, you want to intercept device communication with the Apple App Store. Which of the following applications can be used to hook SSLRead and SSLWrite functions in the itunesstored process to intercept the communication?

In the OWASP testing workflow, code review is performed to check for vulnerabilities during the lifecycle of an application. Also, further application testing is being done to ensure no flaws are missed. Which of the following phases allows you to perform such testing?
In application security, which of thee following features of a web application firewall can you use to protect the application from an application layer DDOS attack?

In application security, an AUT must be verified for compliance with the OWASP Application Security Verification Standard session management requirements. Which of the following must not be verified while performing the verification?

a.option:
Authentication session tokens additionally
set the “HttpOnly” and “secure” attributes
Sessions timeout after a specified period of inactivity
Session id is changed upon re-authentication.

q:
In application security, an IoT application contains the following source code to display files. Which of these inputs must be provided to this device to delete all files in the root directory?

<?php
print(enter file name);
$file=_GET['filename'];
system("cat $file");
?>
In application security, which of these vulnerabilities can be used to redirect calls or text messages using a compromised application?
In application security, which of the following technologies will you use to review the web page metadata for disabled link or scripts in AUT?

In application security, while analyzing the security of an application, you find that it allows an externally-supplied input to serve as an argument for a program that is under its own control. What is the likelihood of an exploit code is attributed to this vulnerability?
In application security, which of the following methods serves as an input vulnerability entry point in a web application?
In application security, which of the following types of access control techniques is suitable when the access to an object is based on the sensitivity of the object?
In application security, which of the following vulnerabilities can be exploited to create a remote shell and run a given command to gather data using a backdoor method?
In application security, a taint analyzer is being used to test vulnerabilities of a web application. Which of the following will you operate in this process?

In application security, you are trying to test a file-sharing application that is added to the Microsoft application store. The application provides support to an in-app drag-and-drop feature for files or images. You are required to assign a classification that is done based on the interface that is used to implement this application feature.
Which of the following classifications will you provide to this application?
In application security, which of the following impacts must be monitored if your servers are affected by the OpenSSL 1.0.1 Heartbleed Bug?
